thread.title: UPDATE 5- steady after hitting three- high, offers support

author: cnbc.com
title: UPDATE 5- steady after hitting three- high, offers support
text:
* Saudi Q1 output to be below output cap, minister says
* Libya declares force majeure on El Feel oilfield (Updates prices, adds comment)
LONDON, Feb 26 (Reuters) - Oil slipped on Monday but still held close to its highest since   17 cents at $67.14 a barrel at 1258 GMT, after rising almost 4 percent last week. U.S. West Texas Intermediate crude was down 3 cents at $63.52   end a mild bout of profit-taking, analysts said.
"There   breakout," he said, adding the expected a price in the range of $60 to $70 this year.
Prices drew some support from Saudi Energy Minister  
He said Saudi Arabia hoped OPEC and its allies would be able to relax output curbs next year and create a permanent framework to stabilise oil markets after the current agreement on supply cuts ends this year.

U.S. energy firms added one oil rig last week,  
Meanwhile, Libya's National Oil Corp said on Saturday it had declared force majeure on the 70,000 bpd El Feel oilfield after a protest by guards closed the field.
(Additional reporting by Osamu Tsukimori in Tokyo; Editing by Larry King and Edmund Blair)
